title: Heavy Ion Composition
subtitle: Universal behavior below the fast-slow transition
description: When normalized to their saturation points, all heavy ion species follow an identical trajectory in slow solar wind, revealing universal physics that doesn't discriminate by mass, charge, or ionization potential. Above saturation, this universality breaks down as element-specific fractionation takes over in fast wind.

related_figures.relevance: Shows the raw data before normalization, revealing the 75 km/s gap between heavy-ion and helium saturation speeds
Explains the divergence above saturation seen in the primary figure—charge state, not mass, controls fast-wind fractionation

related_topics.connection: Heavy ion abundances modulate with the solar cycle
Helium shows the same saturation behavior as heavy ions

paper.title: The transition from slow to fast wind as observed in composition observations
